intro: Clintonia podanisia, commonly known as the white fringeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and its stems are often hairy. Clintonia podanisia thrives in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in rich, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
